adjectives.description: online (comparative more online, superlative most online)

definitionGroups.group: Of a system: connected (generally electrically) to a larger network.

entries.meaning: Of a generator or power plant: connected to the grid.
Of a computer: actively connected to the Internet or to some other communications service.
Available over, or delivered from, the Internet.
examples: I prefer to read online newspapers.
I'll be online tonight, so I'll be able to reply to your email.

entries.meaning: Available on a computer system, even if not networked.
examples: Press the F1 key to access the online help.
The program comes with an online manual, supplied on compact disc.

entries.meaning: Of a system: active, particularly building facilities (such as power) or a factory or power plant.
examples: Once this factory comes online, it will double car production in our country!

entries.meaning: (slang) Immersed in Internet culture. (Usually modified by an intensifier such as extremely or terminally)
While online; while in a running or active state, or connected to the Internet.

verbs.description: online (third-person singular simple present onlines, present participle onlining, simple past and past participle onlined)

entries.meaning: (computing, transitive) To bring (a system, etc.) online; to promote to an active or running state.
examples: The output in Listing 8-2 shows your disk group status prior to onlining the disks, the commands to online your disks, and the status after onlining.
